description: 'Click To Pirate' (4/5). Hit later than other sectors by the scourge of piracy, the sports industry now faces a proliferation of illegal broadcasts, from Telegram to IPTV. Meanwhile, users of streaming platforms criticize what they see as inadequete legal offerings.

Mexico steps up cooperation with the US on drug trafficking
description: Mexico has handed over 26 individuals to the US judiciary, including several accused of drug trafficking. As fentanyl continues to flood the US, Washington is now targeting the political networks supporting the cartels.

headline: Trump targets cultural institutions in Washington to promote his vision of America
description: The US president's push to reassert control in the capital includes reshaping the country's historical narrative, through greater control over the Smithsonian and the Kennedy Center.

headline: In Lyon, green islands offer a cooling solution to heatwaves
description: Elected officials and urban planners say greening the city must shift from a landscaping approach to a strategy focused on cooling in order to adapt to climate change – as was done in the former industrial district of Gerland.

headline: Who's going to lie down on the couch? 'The Sopranos,' the first TV series to tackle mental health
description: 'Breaking The Script' (3/5). In 1999, the TV series 'The Sopranos' introduced viewers to a mafia boss suffering from depression. Through the intense exchanges between this anti-hero and his therapist, mental health became a central theme on television for the first time, where it has continued to thrive ever since.

description: The remarkable series of images created in the 1980s, featuring Avedon's poignant portraits of workers, can now be seen for the first time in Europe.

headline: Trump wields Alaska and Texas gas as global power play
description: The US president is betting big on hydrocarbon exports, turning American oil and gas into a key bargaining chip in trade and geopolitical talks worldwide.

headline: Jordan's Islamists come under pressure
description: Since the popular Muslim Brotherhood movement was banned, one of its offshoots in Jordan, the Islamic Action Front, the largest party in parliament, has been threatened. The pressure also aims to isolate Hamas.
